page.title: 02Agriculture near B.S.E.
page.content: The area is predominantly agricultural, with the emphasis on arable farming. The types of crops grown are cereals (wheat and barley), root crops (sugar beet) and oilseed rape. Farming is highly mechanised and the land is intensively farmed. The average 100 hectare farm would employ no more than four or five men. Fields are increasingly being incorporated into single large units and hedgerows and other traditional field boundaries are disappearing. One part of the survey area is unusual for this part of Suffolk, in that it consists of fruit orchards which are more typical towards Cambridgeshire and the Essex border.
